intro: Landolphia congolensis, commonly known as the Congo star apple, is a woody climbing vine native to Central and Southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces a fleshy, yellow or orange fruit that contains numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in dense rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for both aesthetic and practical purposes.
